intro: Spennera laxa, commonly known as the slender spennera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Spennera laxa typically grows in humid, tropical environments and prefers well-drained soil. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
